member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject
member.summary: Allow elements to be moved using the mouse.

remarks.para: Make the selected elements draggable by mouse. If you want not just drag, but drag & drop, see the jQuery UI Droppable plugin, which provides a drop target for draggables.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Destroy
member.summary: Removes the draggable functionality completely. This will return the element back to its pre-init state.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Disable
member.summary: Disables the draggable.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Enable
member.summary: Enables the draggable.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Option(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value currently associated with the specified optionName.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Option
member.summary: Gets an object containing key/value pairs representing the current draggable options hash.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Option(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the value of the draggable option associated with the specified optionName.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Option(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets one or more options for the draggable.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Widget
member.summary: Returns a jQuery object containing the draggable.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.AddClasses
member.summary: If set to false, will prevent the ui-draggable class from being added. This may be desired as a performance optimization when calling .draggable() on hundreds of elements.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.AppendTo
member.summary: Which element the draggable helper should be appended to while dragging.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Axis
member.summary: Constrains dragging to either the horizontal (x) or vertical (y) axis. Possible values: "x", "y".

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Cancel
member.summary: Prevents dragging from starting on specified elements.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.ConnectToSortable
member.summary: Allows the draggable to be dropped onto the specified sortables. If this option is used, a draggable can be dropped onto a sortable list and then becomes part of it. Note: The helper option must be set to "clone" in order to work flawlessly. Requires the jQuery UI Sortable plugin to be included.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Containment
member.summary: Constrains dragging to within the bounds of the specified element or region.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Cursor
member.summary: The CSS cursor during the drag operation.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.CursorAt
member.summary: Sets the offset of the dragging helper relative to the mouse cursor. Coordinates can be given as a hash using a combination of one or two keys: { top, left, right, bottom }.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Delay
member.summary: Time in milliseconds after mousedown until dragging should start. This option can be used to prevent unwanted drags when clicking on an element.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the draggable if set to true.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Distance
member.summary: Distance in pixels after mousedown the mouse must move before dragging should start. This option can be used to prevent unwanted drags when clicking on an element.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Grid
member.summary: Snaps the dragging helper to a grid, every x and y pixels. The array must be of the form [ x, y ].

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Handle
member.summary: If specified, restricts dragging from starting unless the mousedown occurs on the specified element(s).

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Helper
member.summary: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.IframeFix
member.summary: Prevent iframes from capturing the mousemove events during a drag. Useful in combination with the cursorAt option, or in any case where the mouse cursor may not be over the helper.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the helper while being dragged.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.RefreshPositions
member.summary: If set to true, all droppable positions are calculated on every mousemove.Caution: This solves issues on highly dynamic pages, but dramatically decreases performance.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Revert
member.summary: Whether the element should revert to its start position when dragging stops.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.RevertDuration
member.summary: The duration of the revert animation, in milliseconds. Ignored if the revert option is false.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Scope
member.summary: Used to group sets of draggable and droppable items, in addition to droppable's accept option. A draggable with the same scope value as a droppable will be accepted by the droppable.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Scroll
member.summary: If set to true, container auto-scrolls while dragging.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.ScrollSensitivity
member.summary: Distance in pixels from the edge of the viewport after which the viewport should scroll. Distance is relative to pointer, not the draggable. Ignored if the scroll option is false.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.ScrollSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the window should scroll once the mouse pointer gets within the scrollSensitivity distance. Ignored if the scroll option is false.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Snap
member.summary: Whether the element should snap to other elements.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.SnapMode
member.summary: Determines which edges of snap elements the draggable will snap to. Ignored if the snap option is false. Possible values: "inner", "outer", "both".

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.SnapTolerance
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the snap element edges at which snapping should occur. Ignored if the snap option is false.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.Stack
member.summary: Controls the z-index of the set of elements that match the selector, always brings the currently dragged item to the front. Very useful in things like window managers.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.ZIndex
member.summary: Z-index for the helper while being dragged.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.OnCreate
member.summary: Triggered when the draggable is created.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.OnDrag
member.summary: Triggered while the mouse is moved during the dragging.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.OnStart
member.summary: Triggered when dragging starts.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DraggableObject.OnStop
member.summary: Triggered when dragging stops.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject
member.summary: Create targets for draggable elements.

remarks.para: The jQuery UI Droppable plugin makes selected elements droppable (meaning they accept being dropped on by draggables). You can specify which draggables each will accept.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Destroy
member.summary: Removes the droppable functionality completely. This will return the element back to its pre-init state.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Disable
member.summary: Disables the droppable.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Enable
member.summary: Enables the droppable.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Option(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value currently associated with the specified optionName.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Option
member.summary: Gets an object containing key/value pairs representing the current droppable options hash.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Option(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the value of the droppable option associated with the specified optionName.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Option(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets one or more options for the droppable.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Widget
member.summary: Returns a jQuery object containing the droppable.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Accept
member.summary: Controls which draggable elements are accepted by the droppable.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.ActiveClass
member.summary: If specified, the class will be added to the droppable while an acceptable draggable is being dragged.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.AddClasses
member.summary: If set to false, will prevent the ui-droppable class from being added. This may be desired as a performance optimization when calling .droppable() init on hundreds of elements.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the droppable if set to true.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Greedy
member.summary: By default, when an element is dropped on nested droppables, each droppable will receive the element. However, by setting this option to true, any parent droppables will not receive the element.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.HoverClass
member.summary: If specified, the class will be added to the droppable while an acceptable draggable is being hovered over the droppable.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Scope
member.summary: Used to group sets of draggable and droppable items, in addition to the accept option. A draggable with the same scope value as a droppable will be accepted.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.Tolerance
member.summary:
Specifies which mode to use for testing whether a draggable is hovering over a droppable. Possible values:
"fit": Draggable overlaps the droppable entirely.
"intersect": Draggable overlaps the droppable at least 50% in both directions.
"pointer": Mouse pointer overlaps the droppable.
"touch": Draggable overlaps the droppable any amount.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.OnActivate
member.summary: Triggered when an accepted draggable starts dragging. This can be useful if you want to make the droppable "light up" when it can be dropped on.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.OnCreate
member.summary: Triggered when the droppable is created.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.OnDeactivate
member.summary: Triggered when an accepted draggable stops dragging.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.OnDrop
member.summary: Triggered when an accepted draggable is dropped on the droppable (based on thetolerance option).

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.OnOut
member.summary: Triggered when an accepted draggable is dragged out of the droppable (based on thetolerance option).

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableObject.OnOver
member.summary: Triggered when an accepted draggable is dragged over the droppable (based on thetolerance option).

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.DroppableOptions.Accept
member.summary: Controls which draggable elements are accepted by the droppable.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject
member.summary: Reorder elements in a list or grid using the mouse.

remarks.para: The jQuery UI Sortable plugin makes selected elements sortable by dragging with the mouse.

para.em: Note: In order to sort table rows, the tbody must be made sortable, not the table.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels a change in the current sortable and reverts it to the state prior to when the current sort was started. Useful in the stop and receive callback functions.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Destroy
member.summary: Removes the sortable functionality completely. This will return the element back to its pre-init state.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Disable
member.summary: Disables the sortable.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Enable
member.summary: Enables the sortable.

member.summary: Gets the value currently associated with the specified optionName.

member.summary: Gets an object containing key/value pairs representing the current sortable options hash.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Option(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the value of the sortable option associated with the specified optionName.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Option(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets one or more options for the sortable.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Refresh
member.summary: Refresh the sortable items. Triggers the reloading of all sortable items, causing new items to be recognized.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.RefreshPositions
member.summary: Refresh the cached positions of the sortable items. Calling this method refreshes the cached item positions of all sortables.

summary.para: Serializes the sortable's item ids into a form/ajax submittable string. Calling this method produces a hash that can be appended to any url to easily submit a new item order back to the server.
It works by default by looking at the id of each item in the format "setname_number", and it spits out a hash like "setname[]=number&setname[]=number".

para.em: Note: If serialize returns an empty string, make sure the id attributes include an underscore. They must be in the form: "set_number" For example, a 3 element list with id attributes "foo_1", "foo_5", "foo_2" will serialize to "foo[]=1&foo[]=5&foo[]=2". You can use an underscore, equal sign or hyphen to separate the set and number. For example "foo=1", "foo-1", and "foo_1" all serialize to "foo[]=1".

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.ToArray(System.Object)
member.summary: Serializes the sortable's item id's into an array of string.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Widget
member.summary: Returns a jQuery object containing the sortable.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.AppendTo
member.summary: Defines where the helper that moves with the mouse is being appended to during the drag (for example, to resolve overlap/zIndex issues).

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Axis
member.summary: If defined, the items can be dragged only horizontally or vertically. Possible values: "x", "y".

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.OptionCancel
member.summary: Prevents sorting if you start on elements matching the selector.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.ConnectWith
member.summary: A selector of other sortable elements that the items from this list should be connected to. This is a one-way relationship, if you want the items to be connected in both directions, the connectWith option must be set on both sortable elements.

summary.para: Defines a bounding box that the sortable items are contrained to while dragging.

Note: The element specified for containment must have a calculated width and height (though it need not be explicit). For example, if you have float: left sortable children and specify containment: "parent" be sure to have float: left on the sortable/parent container as well or it will have height: 0, causing undefined behavior.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Cursor
member.summary: Defines the cursor that is being shown while sorting.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.CursorAt
member.summary: Moves the sorting element or helper so the cursor always appears to drag from the same position. Coordinates can be given as a hash using a combination of one or two keys: { top, left, right, bottom }.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Delay
member.summary: Time in milliseconds to define when the sorting should start. Adding a delay helps preventing unwanted drags when clicking on an element.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the sortable if set to true.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Distance
member.summary: Tolerance, in pixels, for when sorting should start. If specified, sorting will not start until after mouse is dragged beyond distance. Can be used to allow for clicks on elements within a handle.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.DropOnEmpty
member.summary: If false, items from this sortable can't be dropped on an empty connect sortable (see the connectWith option.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.ForceHelperSize
member.summary: If true, forces the helper to have a size.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.ForcePlaceholderSize
member.summary: If true, forces the placeholder to have a size.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Grid
member.summary: Snaps the sorting element or helper to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [ x, y ].

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Handle
member.summary: Restricts sort start click to the specified element.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Helper
member.summary: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Items
member.summary: Specifies which items inside the element should be sortable.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Opacity
member.summary: Defines the opacity of the helper while sorting. From 0.01 to 1.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Placeholder
member.summary: A class name that gets applied to the otherwise white space.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Revert
member.summary: Whether the sortable items should revert to their new positions using a smooth animation.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Scroll
member.summary: If set to true, the page scrolls when coming to an edge.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.ScrollSensitivity
member.summary: Defines how near the mouse must be to an edge to start scrolling.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.ScrollSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the window should scroll once the mouse pointer gets within the scrollSensitivity distance.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.Tolerance
member.summary:
Specifies which mode to use for testing whether the item being moved is hovering over another item. Possible values:
"intersect": The item overlaps the other item by at least 50%.
"pointer": The mouse pointer overlaps the other item.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.ZIndex
member.summary: Z-index for element/helper while being sorted.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.OnActivate

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.OnSort
member.summary: This event is triggered during sorting.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableObject.OnStart
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting starts.

member.summary: If defined, the items can be dragged only horizontally or vertically. Possible values: "x", "y".

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Interactions.SortableOptions.ConnectWith
member.summary: A selector of other sortable elements that the items from this list should be connected to. This is a one-way relationship, if you want the items to be connected in both directions, the connectWith option must be set on both sortable elements.

summary.para: Defines a bounding box that the sortable items are contrained to while dragging.

Note: The element specified for containment must have a calculated width and height (though it need not be explicit). For example, if you have float: left sortable children and specify containment: "parent" be sure to have float: left on the sortable/parent container as well or it will have height: 0, causing undefined behavior.

member.summary: Moves the sorting element or helper so the cursor always appears to drag from the same position. Coordinates can be given as a hash using a combination of one or two keys: { top, left, right, bottom }.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOptions.At
member.summary: Defines which position on the target element to align the positioned element against: "horizontal vertical" alignment. See the my option for full details on possible values. Perecentage offsets are relative to the target element.

summary.para: When the positioned element overflows the window in some direction, move it to an alternative position. Similar to my and at, this accepts a single value or a pair for horizontal/vertical, e.g., "flip", "fit", "fit flip", "fit none".

ul.li: "flip": Flips the element to the opposite side of the target and the collision detection is run again to see if it will fit. Whichever side allows more of the element to be visible will be used.
"fit": Shift the element away from the edge of the window.

"flipfit": First applies the flip logic, placing the element on whichever side allows more of the element to be visible. Then the fit logic is applied to ensure as much of the element is visible as possible.
"none": Does not apply any collision detection.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOptions.My
member.summary: Defines which position on the element being positioned to align with the target element: "horizontal vertical" alignment. A single value such as "right" will be normalized to "right center", "top" will be normalized to "center top" (following CSS convention). Acceptable horizontal values: "left", "center", "right". Acceptable vertical values: "top", "center", "bottom". Example: "left top" or "center center". Each dimension can also contain offsets, in pixels or percent, e.g., "right+10 top-25%". Percentage offsets are relative to the element being positioned.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOptions.Of
member.summary: Which element to position against. If you provide a selector or jQuery object, the first matching element will be used. If you provide an event object, the pageX and pageY properties will be used. Example: "#top-menu"

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOptions.Using
member.summary:
When specified, the actual property setting is delegated to this callback. Receives two parameters: The first is a hash of top and left values for the position that should be set and can be forwarded to .css() or .animate().
The second provides feedback about the position and dimensions of both elements, as well as calculations to their relative position. Both target and element have these properties: element, left, top, width, height. In addition, there's horizontal, vertical and important, giving you twelve potential directions like { horizontal: "center", vertical: "left", important: "horizontal" }.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.PositionOptions.Within
member.summary: Element to position within, affecting collision detection. If you provide a selector or jQuery object, the first matching element will be used.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject
member.summary: The base interaction layer.

remarks.para: Similar to jQuery.Widget, the mouse interaction is not intended to be used directly. It is purely a base layer for other widgets to inherit from. This page only documents what is added to jQuery.Widget, but it does include internal methods that are not intended to be overwritten. The intended public API is _mouseStart(), _mouseDrag(), _mouseStop(), and _mouseCapture().

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseCapture
member.summary: Determines whether an interaction should start based on event target of the interaction. The default implementation always returns true.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseDelayMet
member.summary: Determines whether the delay option has been met for the current interaction.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseDestroy
member.summary: Destroys the interaction event handlers. This must be called from the extending widget's _destroy() method.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseDistanceMet
member.summary: Determines whether the distance option has been met for the current interaction.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseDown
member.summary: Handles the beginning of an interaction. Verifies that the event is associated with the primary mouse button and ensures that the delay and distance options are met prior to starting the interaction. When the interaction is ready to start, invokes the _mouseStart() method for the extending widget to handle.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseDrag
member.summary: The extending widget should implement a _mouseDrag() method to handle each movement of an interaction. This method will receive the mouse event associated with the movement.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseInit
member.summary: Initializes the interaction event handlers. This must be called from the extending widget's _create() method.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseMove
member.summary: Handles each movement of the interaction. Invokes the mouseDrag() method for the extending widget to handle.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseStart
member.summary: The extending widget should implement a _mouseStart() method to handle the beginning of an interaction. This method will receive the mouse event associated with the start of the interaction.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseStop
member.summary: The extending widget should implement a _mouseStop() method to handle the end of an interaction. This method will receive the mouse event associated with the end of the interaction.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.MouseObject.MouseUp
member.summary: Handles the end of the interaction. Invokes the mouseStop() method for the extending widget to handle.

member.summary: Time in milliseconds after mousedown until the interaction should start. This option can be used to prevent unwanted interactions when clicking on an element.

member.summary: Distance in pixels after mousedown the mouse must move before the interaction should start. This option can be used to prevent unwanted interactions when clicking on an element.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AccordionObject
member.summary: Convert a pair of headers and content panels into an accordion.

remarks.para: The markup of your accordion container needs pairs of headers and content panels:
Accordions support arbitrary markup, but each content panel must always be the next sibling after its associated header. See the header option for information on how to use custom markup structures.
The panels can be activated programmatically by setting the active option.
When focus is on a header, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: UP/LEFT - Move focus to the previous header. If on first header, moves focus to last header.
DOWN/RIGHT - Move focus to the next header. If on last header, moves focus to first header.
HOME - Move focus to the first header.
END - Move focus to the last header.
SPACE/ENTER - Activate panel associated with focused header.

remarks.para: When focus is in a panel:

ul.li: CTRL+UP: Move focus to associated header.
Effects Core (optional; for use with the animate option)

member.summary: The event that accordion headers will react to in order to activate the associated panel. Multiple events can be specificed, separated by a space.

summary.para: Selector for the header element, applied via .find() on the main accordion element. Content panels must be the sibling immedately after their associated headers.
Controls the height of the accordion and each panel. Possible values:

ul.li: "auto": All panels will be set to the height of the tallest panel.
"fill": Expand to the available height based on the accordion's parent height.
"content": Each panel will be only as tall as its content.

summary.para: Icons to use for headers, matching an icon defined by the jQuery UI CSS Framework. Set to false to have no icons displayed.

ul.li: header (string, default: "ui-icon-triangle-1-e")
activeHeader (string, default: "ui-icon-triangle-1-s")

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject
member.summary: Autocomplete enables users to quickly find and select from a pre-populated list of values as they type, leveraging searching and filtering.

remarks.para: By giving an Autocomplete field focus or entering something into it, the plugin starts searching for entries that match and displays a list of values to choose from. By entering more characters, the user can filter down the list to better matches.

This can be used to choose previously selected values, such as entering tags for articles or entering email addresses from an address book. Autocomplete can also be used to populate associated information, such as entering a city name and getting the zip code.

You can pull data in from a local or remote source: Local is good for small data sets, e.g., an address book with 50 entries; remote is necessary for big data sets, such as a database with hundreds or millions of entries to select from. To find out more about customizing the data soure, see the documentation for the source option.
When the menu is open, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: UP - Move focus to the previous item. If on first item, move focus to the input. If on the input, move focus to last item.
DOWN - Move focus to the next item. If on last item, move focus to the input. If on the input, move focus to the first item.
ESCAPE - Close the menu.
ENTER - Select the currently focused item and close the menu.
TAB - Select the currently focused item, close the menu, and move focus to the next focusable element.
PAGE UP/DOWN - Scroll through a page of items (based on height of menu). It's generally a bad idea to display so many items that users need to page..

remarks.para: When the menu is closed, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: UP/DOWN - Open the menu, if the minLength has been met.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.Close
member.summary: Closes the Autocomplete menu. Useful in combination with the search method, to close the open menu.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.Destroy
member.summary: Removes the autocomplete functionality completely. This will return the element back to its pre-init state.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.Search(System.String)
member.summary: Triggers a search event and invokes the data source if the event is not canceled. Can be used by a selectbox-like button to open the suggestions when clicked. When invoked with no parameters, the current input's value is used. Can be called with an empty string and minLength: 0 to display all items.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.Widget
member.summary: Returns a jQuery object containing the menu element. Although the menu items are constantly created and destroyed, the menu element itself is created during initialization and is constantly reused.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.AppendTo
member.summary: Which element the menu should be appended to. When the value is null, the parents of the input field will be checked for a class of ui-front. If an element with the ui-front class is found, the menu will be appended to that element. Regardless of the value, if no element is found, the menu will be appended to the body.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.AutoFocus
member.summary: If set to true the first item will automatically be focused when the menu is shown.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.Delay
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds between when a keystroke occurs and when a search is performed. A zero-delay makes sense for local data (more responsive), but can produce a lot of load for remote data, while being less responsive.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the autocomplete if set to true.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.MinLength
member.summary: The minimum number of characters a user must type before a search is performed. Zero is useful for local data with just a few items, but a higher value should be used when a single character search could match a few thousand items.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.Position
member.summary: Identifies the position of the suggestions menu in relation to the associated input element. The of option defaults to the input element, but you can specify another element to position against. You can refer to the jQuery UI Position utility for more details about the various options.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.Source
member.summary:
Defines the data to use, must be specified.
Independent of the variant you use, the label is always treated as text. If you want the label to be treated as html you can use Scott Gonzlez' html extension. The demos all focus on different variations of the source option - look for one that matches your use case, and check out the code.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.OnChange
member.summary: Triggered when the field is blurred, if the value has changed.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.OnClose
member.summary: Triggered when the menu is hidden. Not every close event will be accompanied by a change event.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.OnCreate
member.summary: Triggered when the autocomplete is created.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.OnFocus
member.summary:
Triggered when focus is moved to an item (not selecting). The default action is to replace the text field's value with the value of the focused item, though only if the event was triggered by a keyboard interaction.
Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu item from being focused.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.OnOpen
member.summary: Triggered when the suggestion menu is opened or updated.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.OnResponse
member.summary: Triggered after a search completes, before the menu is shown. Useful for local manipulation of suggestion data, where a custom source option callback is not required. This event is always triggered when a search completes, even if the menu will not be shown because there are no results or the Autocomplete is disabled.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.OnSearch
member.summary: Triggered before a search is performed, after minLength and delay are met. If canceled, then no request will be started and no items suggested.

member.name: E:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteObject.OnSelect
member.summary:
Triggered when an item is selected from the menu. The default action is to replace the text field's value with the value of the selected item.
Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu from closing.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.AppendTo
member.summary: Which element the menu should be appended to. When the value is null, the parents of the input field will be checked for a class of ui-front. If an element with the ui-front class is found, the menu will be appended to that element. Regardless of the value, if no element is found, the menu will be appended to the body.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.AutoFocus
member.summary: If set to true the first item will automatically be focused when the menu is shown.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.Delay
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds between when a keystroke occurs and when a search is performed. A zero-delay makes sense for local data (more responsive), but can produce a lot of load for remote data, while being less responsive.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the autocomplete if set to true.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.MinLength
member.summary: The minimum number of characters a user must type before a search is performed. Zero is useful for local data with just a few items, but a higher value should be used when a single character search could match a few thousand items.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.Position
member.summary: Identifies the position of the suggestions menu in relation to the associated input element. The of option defaults to the input element, but you can specify another element to position against. You can refer to the jQuery UI Position utility for more details about the various options.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.Source
member.summary:
Defines the data to use, must be specified.
Independent of the variant you use, the label is always treated as text. If you want the label to be treated as html you can use Scott Gonzlez' html extension. The demos all focus on different variations of the source option - look for one that matches your use case, and check out the code.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.OnChange
member.summary: Triggered when the field is blurred, if the value has changed.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.OnClose
member.summary: Triggered when the menu is hidden. Not every close event will be accompanied by a change event.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.OnCreate
member.summary: Triggered when the autocomplete is created.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.OnFocus
member.summary:
Triggered when focus is moved to an item (not selecting). The default action is to replace the text field's value with the value of the focused item, though only if the event was triggered by a keyboard interaction.
Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu item from being focused.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.OnOpen
member.summary: Triggered when the suggestion menu is opened or updated.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.OnResponse
member.summary: Triggered after a search completes, before the menu is shown. Useful for local manipulation of suggestion data, where a custom source option callback is not required. This event is always triggered when a search completes, even if the menu will not be shown because there are no results or the Autocomplete is disabled.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.OnSearch
member.summary: Triggered before a search is performed, after minLength and delay are met. If canceled, then no request will be started and no items suggested.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.AutoCompleteOptions.OnSelect
member.summary:
Triggered when an item is selected from the menu. The default action is to replace the text field's value with the value of the selected item.
Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu from closing.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonObject
member.summary: Themable buttons and button sets.

remarks.para: Button enhances standard form elements like buttons, inputs and anchors to themable buttons with appropiate hover and active styles.

In addition to basic push buttons, radio buttons and checkboxes (inputs of type radio and checkbox) can be converted to buttons. Their associated label is styled to appear as the button, while the underlying input is updated on click. For the association to work properly, give the input an id attribute, and refer to that in the label's for attribute. Don't nest the input inside the label, as that causes accessbility problems.

In order to group radio buttons, Button also provides an additional widget, called Buttonset. Buttonset is used by selecting a container element (which contains the radio buttons) and calling .buttonset(). Buttonset will also provide visual grouping, and therefore should be used whenever you have a group of buttons. It works by selecting all descendants and applying .button() to them. You can enable and disable a button set, which will enable and disable all contained buttons. Destroying a button set also calls each button's destroy method.
When using an input of type button, submit or reset, support is limited to plain text labels with no icons.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonObject.Destroy
member.summary: Removes the button functionality completely. This will return the element back to its pre-init state.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonObject.Disable
member.summary: Disables the button.

member.summary: Enables the button.

member.summary: Refreshes the visual state of the button. Useful for updating button state after the native element's checked or disabled state is changed programmatically.

member.summary: Returns a jQuery object containing the button.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonObject.Icons
member.summary: Icons to display, with or without text (see text option). By default, the primary icon is displayed on the left of the label text and the secondary is displayed on the right. The positioning can be controlled via CSS. The value for the primary and secondary properties must be a class name, e.g., "ui-icon-gear". For using only one icon: icons: { primary: "ui-icon-locked" }. For using two icons: icons: { primary: "ui-icon-gear", secondary: "ui-icon-triangle-1-s" }.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonObject.Label
member.summary: Text to show in the button. When not specified (null), the element's HTML content is used, or its value attribute if the element is an input element of type submit or reset, or the HTML content of the associated label element if the element is an input of type radio or checkbox.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ButtonObject.Text
member.summary: Whether to show the label. When set to false no text will be displayed, but the icons option must be enabled, otherwise the text option will be ignored.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerObject
member.summary: Select a date from a popup or inline calendar

remarks.para: The jQuery UI Datepicker is a highly configurable plugin that adds datepicker functionality to your pages. You can customize the date format and language, restrict the selectable date ranges and add in buttons and other navigation options easily.
By default, the datepicker calendar opens in a small overlay when the associated text field gains focus. For an inline calendar, simply attach the datepicker to a div or span.
While the datepicker is open, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: PAGE UP: Move to the previous month.
PAGE DOWN: Move to the next month.
CTRL+PAGE UP: Move to the previous year.
CTRL+PAGE DOWN: Move to the next year.
CTRL+HOME: Move to the current month. Open the datepicker if closed.
CTRL+LEFT: Move to the previous day.
CTRL+RIGHT: Move to the next day.
CTRL+UP: Move to the previous week.
CTRL+DOWN: Move the next week.
ENTER: Select the focused date.
CTRL+END: Close the datepicker and erase the date.
ESCAPE: Close the datepicker without selection.
$.datepicker.setDefaults( settings ) - Set settings for all datepicker instances.
$.datepicker.formatDate( format, date, settings ) - Format a date into a string value with a specified format.
$.datepicker.parseDate( format, value, settings ) - Extract a date from a string value with a specified format.
$.datepicker.iso8601Week( date ) - Determine the week of the year for a given date: 1 to 53.
$.datepicker.noWeekends - Set as beforeShowDay function to prevent selection of weekends.

remarks.para: Datepicker provides support for localizing its content to cater for different languages and date formats. Each localization is contained within its own file with the language code appended to the name, e.g., jquery.ui.datepicker-fr.js for French. The desired localization file should be included after the main datepicker code. Each localization file adds its settings to the set of available localizations and automatically applies them as defaults for all instances.

The $.datepicker.regional attribute holds an array of localizations, indexed by language code, with "" referring to the default (English). Each entry is an object with the following attributes: closeText, prevText, nextText, currentText, monthNames, monthNamesShort, dayNames, dayNamesShort, dayNamesMin, weekHeader, dateFormat, firstDay, isRTL, showMonthAfterYear, and yearSuffix.
You can restore the default localizations with:
And can then override an individual datepicker for a specific locale:

ul.li: Effects Core (optional; for use with the showAnim option)

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.IsRTL
member.summary: Whether the current language is drawn from right to left.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.MaxDate
member.summary: The maximum selectable date. When set to null, there is no maximum.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.MinDate
member.summary: The minimum selectable date. When set to null, there is no minimum.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.MonthNames
member.summary: The list of full month names, for use as requested via the dateFormat option.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.MonthNamesShort
member.summary: The list of abbreviated month names, as used in the month header on each datepicker and as requested via the dateFormat option.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.NavigationAsDateFormat
member.summary: Whether the prevText and nextText options should be parsed as dates by the [[UI/Datepicker/formatDate|formatDate]] function, allowing them to display the target month names for example.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.NextText
member.summary: The text to display for the next month link. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.NumberOfMonths
member.summary: The number of months to show at once.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.OnChangeMonthYear
member.summary: Called when the datepicker moves to a new month and/or year. The function receives the selected year, month (1-12), and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.OnClose
member.summary: Called when the datepicker is closed, whether or not a date is selected. The function receives the selected date as text ("" if none) and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.OnSelect
member.summary: Called when the datepicker is selected. The function receives the selected date as text and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.PrevText
member.summary: The text to display for the previous month link. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.SelectOtherMonths
member.summary: Whether days in other months shown before or after the current month are selectable. This only applies if the showOtherMonths option is set to true.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShortYearCutoff
member.summary: The cutoff year for determining the century for a date (used in conjunction with [[UI/Datepicker#option-dateFormat|dateFormat]] 'y'). Any dates entered with a year value less than or equal to the cutoff year are considered to be in the current century, while those greater than it are deemed to be in the previous century.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShowAnim
member.summary: The name of the animation used to show and hide the datepicker. Use "show" (the default), "slideDown", "fadeIn", any of the jQuery UI effects. Set to an empty string to disable animation.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShowButtonPanel
member.summary: Whether to show the button panel.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShowCurrentAtPos
member.summary: When displaying multiple months via the numberOfMonths option, the showCurrentAtPos option defines which position to display the current month in.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShowMonthAfterYear
member.summary: Whether to show the month after the year in the header.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShowOn
member.summary: When the datepicker should appear. The datepicker can appear when the field receives focus ("focus"), when a button is clicked ("button"), or when either event occurs ("both").

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShowOptions
member.summary: If using one of the jQuery UI effects for the showAnim option, you can provide additional settings for that animation via this option.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShowOtherMonths
member.summary: Whether to display dates in other months (non-selectable) at the start or end of the current month. To make these days selectable use the selectOtherMonths option.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.ShowWeek
member.summary: When true, a column is added to show the week of the year. The calculateWeek option determines how the week of the year is calculated. You may also want to change the firstDay option.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.StepMonths
member.summary: Set how many months to move when clicking the previous/next links.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.WeekHeader
member.summary: The text to display for the week of the year column heading. Use the showWeek option to display this column.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.YearRange
member.summary: The range of years displayed in the year drop-down: either relative to today's year ("-nn:+nn"), relative to the currently selected year ("c-nn:c+nn"), absolute ("nnnn:nnnn"), or combinations of these formats ("nnnn:-nn"). Note that this option only affects what appears in the drop-down, to restrict which dates may be selected use the minDate and/or maxDate options.

member.name: P:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DatePickerOptions.YearSuffix
member.summary: Additional text to display after the year in the month headers.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.DialogObject
member.summary: Open content in an interactive overlay.

remarks.para: A dialog is a floating window that contains a title bar and a content area. The dialog window can be moved, resized and closed with the 'x' icon by default.
If the content length exceeds the maximum height, a scrollbar will automatically appear.
A bottom button bar and semi-transparent modal overlay layer are common options that can be added.

ul.li: Draggable (optional; for use with the draggable option)
Resizable (optional; for use with the resizable option)
Effects Core (optional; for use with the show and hide options)

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.MenuObject
member.summary: Themeable menu with mouse and keyboard interactions for navigation.

remarks.para: A menu can be created from any valid markup as long as the elements have a strict parent/child relationship and each menu item has an anchor. The most commonly used element is the unordered list (<ul>):

If you use a structure other than <ul>/<li>, including using the same element for the menu and the menu items, use the menus option to specify a way to differentiate the two elements, e.g., menus: "div.menuElement".
Any menu item can be disabled by adding the ui-state-disabled class to that element.
To add icons to the menu, include them in the markup:
Menu automatically adds the necessary padding to items without icons.

ul.li: ENTER/SPACE: Invoke the focused menu item's action, which may be opening a submenu.
UP: Move focus to the previous menu item.
DOWN: Move focus to the next menu item.
RIGHT: Open the submenu, if available.
LEFT: Close the current submenu and move focus to the parent menu item. If not in a submenu, do nothing.
ESCAPE: Close the current submenu and move focus to the parent menu item. If not in a submenu, do nothing.

remarks.para: Typing a letter moves focus to the first item whose title starts with that character. Repeating the same character cycles through matching items. Typing more characters within the one second timer matches those characters.
Disabled items can receive keyboard focus, but do not allow any other interaction.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.MenuObject.Blur(jQueryApi.jQueryEvent)
member.summary: Removes focus from a menu, resets any active element styles and triggers the menu's blur event.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.ProgressBarObject
member.summary: Display status of a determinate or indeterminate process.

remarks.para: The progress bar is designed to display the current percent complete for a process. The bar is coded to be flexibly sized through CSS and will scale to fit inside its parent container by default.

A determinate progress bar should only be used in situations where the system can accurately update the current status. A determinate progress bar should never fill from left to right, then loop back to empty for a single process if the actual status cannot be calculated, an indeterminate progress bar should be used to provide user feedback.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SliderObject
member.summary: Drag a handle to select a numeric value.

remarks.para: The jQuery UI Slider plugin makes selected elements into sliders. There are various options such as multiple handles and ranges. The handle can be moved with the mouse or the arrow keys.

The slider widget will create handle elements with the class ui-slider-handle on initialization. You can specify custom handle elements by creating and appending the elements and adding the ui-slider-handle class before initialization. It will only create the number of handles needed to match the length of value/values. For example, if you specify values: [ 1, 5, 18 ] and create one custom handle, the plugin will create the other two.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.SpinnerObject
member.summary: Enhance a text input for entering numeric values, with up/down buttons and arrow key handling.

remarks.para: Spinner, or number stepper, widget is perfect for handling all kinds of numeric input. It allow users to type a value directly or modify an existing value by spinning with the keyboard, mouse or scrollwheel. When combined with Globalize, you can even spin currencies and dates in a variety of locales.

Spinner wraps a text input, adds two buttons to increment and decrement the current value, along with handling key events for the same purpose. It delegates to Globalize for number formatting and parsing.

ul.li: UP: Increment the value by one step.
DOWN: Decrement the value by one step.
PAGE UP: Increment the value by one page.
PAGE DOWN: Decrement the value by one page.

remarks.para: Focus stays in the text field, even after using the mouse to click one of the spin buttons.

ul.li: Globalize (external, optional; for use with the culture and numberFormat options)

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TabsObject
member.summary: A single content area with multiple panels, each associated with a header in a list.

remarks.para: Tabs are generally used to break content into multiple sections that can be swapped to save space, much like an accordion.

The content for each tab panel can be defined in-page or can be loaded via Ajax; both are handled automatically based on the href of the anchor associated with the tab. By default tabs are activated on click, but the events can be changed to hover via the event option.
When focus is on a tab, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: UP/LEFT: Move focus to the previous tab. If on first tab, moves focus to last tab. Activate focused tab after a short delay.
DOWN/RIGHT: Move focus to the next tab. If on last tab, moves focus to first tab. Activate focused tab after a short delay.
HOME: Move focus to the first tab. Activate focused tab after a short delay.
END: Move focus to the last tab. Activate focused tab after a short delay.
SPACE: Activate panel associated with focused tab.
ENTER: Activate or toggle panel associated with focused tab.
ALT+PAGE UP: Move focus to the previous tab and immediately activate.
ALT+PAGE DOWN: Move focus to the next tab and immediately activate.

remarks.para: When focus is in a panel, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: CTRL+UP: Move focus to associated tab.
ALT+PAGE UP: Move focus to the previous tab and immediately activate.
ALT+PAGE DOWN: Move focus to the next tab and immediately activate.
Effects Core (optional; for use with the show and hide options)

member.name: T:jQueryApi.UI.Widgets.TooltipObject
member.summary: Customizable, themeable tooltips, replacing native tooltips.

remarks.para: Tooltip replaces native tooltips, making them themable as well as allowing various customizations:

ul.li: Display other content than just the title, like inline footnotes or extra content retrieved via Ajax.
Customize the positioning, e.g., to center the tooltip above elements.
Add extra styling to customize the appearance, for warning or error fields.

remarks.para: A fade animation is used by default to show and hide the tooltip, making the appearance a bit more organic, compared to just toggling the visiblity. This can be customized with the show and hide options.
The items and content options need to stay in-sync. If you change one of them, you need to change the other.

In general, disabled elements do not trigger any DOM events. Therefore, it is not possible to properly control tooltips for disabled elements, since we need to listen to events to determine when to show and hide the tooltip. As a result, jQuery UI does not guarantee any level of support for tooltips attached to disabled elements. Unfortunately, this means that if you require tooltips on disabled elements, you may end up with a mixture of native tooltips and jQuery UI tooltips.

ul.li: Effects Core (optional; for use with the show and hide options)

summary.para: Configuration for the Position utility. The of property defaults to the target element, but can also be overriden.

para.em: Note: In 1.9.0, the default value was { my: "left+15 center", at: "right center", collision: "flipfit" }, but this was changed to more closely match native tooltip positioning.
